result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary Peterson Tijan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If Extended Supervision is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Court deems defendant eligible for any programs that are now available or that become available.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall abide by all conditions set forth by DOC.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mary Peterson Tijan

records.addlTxt: Amended Restitution Order
Amended Restitution Order
Bill of Sale
for Return of Property filed by Atty Wickman on behalf of Mr. Tijan

DA calls case at 11:46 a.m.  Tyler Wickman and Andrew Tijan present.  Def and attorney not present.  Atty Schellgell gives background to Court.  Proposed Order given to Court.  State-not objecting but parties are divorced.  Who owns what?  Atty Schellgell indicates Atty Rafferty did call JA and stated he and def would not be present.  A Bill of Sale is given to Court.  Court reviews list.  State has no objection to some items but wants clarification.  Circled items on list are to be returned, lined items Mr. Tijan has no claim.  DA has logistical question.  Officer Packmayer is not present.  DA requests time to go through items.  Court grants motion and gives PD 48 hours to produce items on list.  Adj.  klr
Motion hearing on July 16, 2018 at 11:45 am.
Letter from Atty. Wickman to court re: possible motion hearing
Proposed Order
Application for Return of Property

ADDRESS INFO for Mary Peterson Tijan
Current: N10360 Vanderhagen Road, Ironwood, MI 49938 United States  (Effective: 02-27-2018)
Prior: 112 Germania Street, Hurley, WI 54534
to Judge Madden from DOC re ERP
of 05-26-2017 Sentencing Hearing
to Judge Madden from DOC re sentence with note to adjust from Judge.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment

Special Prosecutor Frederick J. Schellgell appears on behalf of the State of Wisconsin, accompanied by Matthew J. Tingstad, District Attorney.  Mary P. Tijan appears with counsel, M. Joseph Rafferty, Jr.  DA calls case at 1:15 p.m.  Cites appearances.  Parties met before court.  Atty Rafferty satisfied agreement reached.  Spec.Pros. Schellgell states agreement.  Def to plead gulty to Count #1, 2-7 dismissed and read in.  Joint recommendation of 8 years, 3 yrs Prison/5 years ES, DNA sample and surcharge, costs, restitution of $227,161.97.  State has conferred with victims.  Factual basis offerred is criminal complaint with attachments by DA.  No PSI requested by either party per DA.  Atty Rafferty-client stipulates factual basis in complaint and agrees.  PLQ file.  Per atty Rafferty, went over with def.  Def pleads gulty to Count 1.  Def freely pleads.  PLQ filed, reviewed by court.  Def admits signing and giving answers.  Atty Rafferty satisfied def freely pleads.  Court accepts plea and finds gulty.  Parties address court and corrections to PLQ.  Corrections are accepted and part of record.  State is not calling any witnesses, filed statements.  Support letters also filed by atty Rafferty.  1:25 p.m.-Joe P. makes statement to def.  1:27 p.m. Mike S. makes statement to def. 1:29 p.m.  Atty Rafferty addresses court.  Asks Court to follow agreement.  Also asks Court to find def eligibloe for WI AODA programs.  1:50 p.m.  Spec. Pros. Schellgell responds.  Stands by negotiations.  Mike S. addressess recoupment of money.  1:53 p.m.  Right of allocution exercised by def but preceeded by atty Rafferty addressing court.  Atty Schellgell addresses court.  Court addresses def and counsel.  Sentences def to the following:  10 years prison system-3 years prison/7 years ES.  WEDS given to def.   Costs, restitution, DNA sample and surcharge.  Court deems def eligible for any programs available.  Any financial obligations due at end of ES converted to a judgment.  3 days CTS. DRI Counts 2-7.   klr
Carolyn K.
Cally B.
Letters of Support for Defendant

Defendant Mary Peterson Tijan in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.   Frederick j. Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin, is special prosecutor.  DA Matthew J. Tingstad also appeared.   DA Schellgell calls case at 11:40 a.m.  Cites appearances.  Indicates court reporter is wife.  No conflict per court.  Rafferty requests adjournment.  Gives explanation for request.  Court grants continuance.  Grants defendant's motion to reschedule to 5/4/17 at 10:00 a.m.  7/31 trial date is to stay in place.  Bond continues.  Adjourned at 11:45 a.m.  klr

Info filed on 11/17.  Def acknowledges rct, waives reading and def stands mute per attorney.  Per court, NG to be entered on def's behalf.   Trial to be set. Bond to be continued as established.  Adjourned at 10:37 a.m.  klr

Per attorney, def waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions def re waiver-def agrees with attorney.  Court grants request.  Argn to be scheduled not to exceed 30 days.  Bond continues per court.  klr

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 1:22 p.m.  Defendant Mary Peterson Tijan in court with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case, cites appearances.  States charges.  Complaint served.  Atty Rafferty acks rct, waives rdg, waives time limits for prelim but would like a pre prelim STC.  Def agrees with atty, court allows expansion of time limits, but preserves rt to prelim.  Bond continues.  STC to be scheduled by counsel.  First week of October.  klr
Initial appearance on August 31, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

10:10 a.m.  Defendant Mary Peterson Tijan in court (in custody) with attorney M. Joseph Rafferty appearing via phone.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin via phone.  Andrew Tijan also present.  DA Schellgell calls case and cites appearances.  No objection to DA and attorney appearing by phone.  DA gives history of bond hearing of 7/21/16.  Bond revision agreement discussed.  DA asks for $100,000 signature bond revision with same conditions.  Mr. Tijan to co-sign in case of any violation.  Court swears in Mr. Tijan who agrees to accept bond conditions to co-sign.  No objection by atty. Rafferty.  Court grants change in bond to signature, $100,000, same conditions.  Case to be set for initial within next 30 days.  wmg
of Bond Modification Hearing held on 7/22/16

No contact with the following persons or entities, or their employees, directly or indirectly, personally, telephonically, or by any other means, including but not limited to electronically:  Iron County DHS, Iron County Clerk's Office, Iron County Treasurer's Office, Iron County Community Credit Union, Capital One Bank, Barclays Bank, Miller Vision, Greenbranch Dental, Chippewa Valley Bank, Gogebic Community College, River Valley Bank.  No use of the Internet, surrender passport, surrender all Iron County, WI property, including but not limited to, any keys to any County facilities.
Sealed

Defendant Mary Peterson Tijan in court, in custody.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case.  No complaint filed at this time.  Cites appearances.  Public Def info given to def.  DA states possible charges.  DA requests $10,000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with individuals listed on attachment, no internet, surrender passport and all IC property including keys.  DA expresses concerns with contact with son and husband.  Court determines impossible to enforce no contact with them.  Court questions def re bond.  Right to attorney explained.  Court sets $10,000 cash bond with provisions listed on attachment.  As soon as def has attorney, can have another bond hearing.  Conditions typed up by DA's office filed with court.  Court reviews and imposes.  Attached to bond, per Court.  Initial app set for 7/25/16.  klr
